summary: japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the most important cause of epidemic encephalitis in most Asian regions. the virus belongs to the genus Flavivirus of the family Flaviviridae. in southeast Asia, the most important flaviviruses are JEV and dengue viruses (DENV) in northern Australia, Kunjin virus is found to co-circulate with JEV [5]. there is evidence that WNV infection in India from Japanese encephalitis nonendemic areas and endemic areas [7] positive sera showed that prM reactivity could be used to differentiate JEV-positive sera from WNV- and DENV-positive sera. prM and antibodies against prM would be useful for conducting seroepidemiological studies of flavivirus infections. but because prM is a membrane protein, it is difficult to express it in Escherichia coli GenBank accession numbers are listed in the parentheses. epitope M14-13 was highly conserved across these JEV strains. strain JKT6468--a genotype 4 JEV strain--has one amino acid residue (113N) different from that of the epitope M14-13 (113D) this amino acid residue replacement did not affect the reactivity of the epitope to MAb 2F7- and JEV-positive swine sera. cross-reactivity among flaviviruses has been a great diagnostic challenge. epitope identification was useful for elucidating antigenic characteristics of the prM protein. epitopes on E protein [15] and NS1 protein [16] of JEV have been mapped. thus far, the epitope on the PrM/M protein has not been mapped. the sera were obtained from pigs reared in pig farms. the sera were first tested by indirect ELISA and latex agglutination test. ninety-six-well microtiter plates were coated with purified fusion protein or denatured inclusion body in 0.1 M carbonate buffer (pH 9.6) at 4°C overnight and blocked with 5% skim milk for 3 h. the plates were washed 3 times with PBST (phosphate buffered saline, PBS with 0.1% Tween 20) the blot was probed with an appropriate secondary antibody (1:5,000) for 1 h at 37°C. each blot was washed 3 times with PBST (10 min each time) each blot was then washed 3 times with PBST. epitope-specific MAb and fluorescein isothiocyanate (FITC)-conjugated goat anti-mouse IgG (Jackson IR) were used as primary and secondary antibodies. the samples were analyzed by using a leica microscope. the annealed fragment was cloned into the expression vector pGEX-6p-1. the inserts in the recombinant plasmids were sequenced. the recombinant plasmids were induced with 0.1 M isopropyl-D-thiogalactopyranoside. western blotting Virus-infected cell lysates or expressed fusion proteins were mixed with an equal volume of sample loading buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 6.8;
